I don't think this is needed.
My idea was to use this to show `nhdsWithin_lt_le_nhdsWithin_stolzSet`. Will that approach work and if so will it be shorter than your golf?

You don't need the precise statement on the intersection (note that I only used that the open interval from `0` to `1` is contained in any nonempty Stolz set in my suggested proof), so I doubt that using it will give you a shorter (in total) proof.

```suggestion
theorem nhdsWithin_lt_le_nhdsWithin_stolzSet (hM : 1 < M) :
    (𝓝[<] 1).map ofReal' ≤ 𝓝[stolzSet M] 1 := by
  rw [← tendsto_id']
  refine tendsto_map' <| tendsto_nhdsWithin_of_tendsto_nhds_of_eventually_within ofReal'
    (tendsto_nhdsWithin_of_tendsto_nhds <| ofRealCLM.continuous.tendsto' 1 1 rfl) <| ?_
  simp only [eventually_iff, norm_eq_abs, abs_ofReal, abs_lt, mem_nhdsWithin]
  refine ⟨Set.Ioo 0 2, isOpen_Ioo, by norm_num, fun x hx ↦ ?_⟩
  simp only [Set.mem_inter_iff, Set.mem_Ioo, Set.mem_Iio] at hx
  simp only [Set.mem_setOf_eq, stolzSet, ← ofReal_one, ← ofReal_sub, norm_eq_abs, abs_ofReal,
    abs_of_pos hx.1.1, abs_of_pos <| sub_pos.mpr hx.2]
  exact ⟨hx.2, one_mul (1 - x) ▸ mul_lt_mul_of_pos_right hM <| sub_pos.mpr hx.2⟩ 
```

A golf for the last line:
```lean
  exact ⟨hx.2, lt_mul_left (sub_pos.mpr hx.2) hM⟩
```

```suggestion
  exact ⟨hx.2, lt_mul_left (sub_pos.mpr hx.2) hM⟩
```

```suggestion
  rw [← zero_mul (-1 / (z - 1))]
  refine Tendsto.mul ?_ ?_
  · simpa only [neg_zero, neg_sub] using (tendsto_sub_nhds_zero_iff.mpr h).neg
  · conv =>
      enter [1,n]
      rw [geom_sum_eq (by contrapose! hz; simp [hz]), sub_div, sub_eq_add_neg, ← neg_div]
    rw [← zero_add (-1 / (z - 1)), ← zero_div (z - 1)]
    refine Tendsto.add (Tendsto.div_const (tendsto_pow_atTop_nhds_0_of_norm_lt_1 hz) (z - 1)) ?_
    simp only [zero_div, zero_add, tendsto_const_nhds_iff]
```
Maybe not that much better, but it avoids going via the norm.
I think `powerSeries` in the name would be better (even though the statement does not mention terms of type `PowerSeries`).
That is a matter for the dependency #9955 (but I have applied the rename there).
The suggestion to rename `power` to `powerSeries` also applies to this and the following two statements.
We merge #9955 first and then I'll get to this.
@MichaelStollBayreuth done.
Please move `h` to the statements, otherwise they're impossible to understand in isolation.
Done.
Is there a reason why you use Stolz sets instead of the simpler cone of angle \le \theta < pi/2 based at 1? This would be more geometric and easier to use in practice.
IIRC, the condition comes up naturally in the proof. One could add a variant using the cone after the fact, though.
@Parcly-Taxel can you address this comment before you mark `awaiting-review` again?
@sgouezel I don't know how to change to the cone filter without importing all of Euclidean geometry. There's no simple way to do it.
@j-loreaux yeah, done.
